title: Riot Lyte: "Only 10% of League players are classified as positive." The rest are neutral or toxic.

embed.description: League of Legends can't seem to shake its reputation for toxicity -- but it can make substantial changes to player behavior, as part of a ongoing campaign for change in the community.

replies.body:
Depends what they classify as positive and neutral.

Calling someone shit if they are 1/10 isn't toxic.
Apparently it is, and that's why I've been chat restricted so many times. So yeah, don't do it

> [{quoted}](name=Batchy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=tONrE2PP,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-21T13:18:37.082+0000)
>
> Depends what they classify as positive and neutral.
> 
> Calling someone shit if they are 1/10 isn't toxic.

gg look at this toxic player Kappa

He said he was gonna perma ban racists last year
has a little bitch there are a lot of toxic players, still no tribunal in OCE, he must really care a lot Kappa

what he considers toxic?

Dude he just plainly made it clear that it's WE as a community of LoL players that call it toxic.
